name: Assumption - Golden Protection Elite

rules.description: Applicant's weight must not exceed the threshold corresponding to their height as per the following table

rules: Lost more than 10% body weight in past 12 months
Currently admitted to hospital or in long-term/skilled care
Unexplained symptoms or pending investigations or surgeries
Diagnosed with HIV, ALS, dementia, cystic fibrosis, or terminal illness
Family history of Huntington’s or polycystic kidney disease (age ≤ 50)
Organ/bone marrow transplant, CHF, or cardiomyopathy in last 10 years
Heart attack, angina, stroke, or kidney issues in past 5 years
Cancer (except basal cell) or leukemia in past 5 years
Diabetes + any of the following in last 5 years: stroke, heart attack, gangrene, etc.
Chronic respiratory disorder needing oxygen in past 10 years
Steroid treatment or hospitalization for respiratory issue (past 2 years)
Hepatitis, cirrhosis, or pancreatitis (chronic or recurrent)
Neurological, autoimmune, or psychiatric illness
Driver’s license suspended or revoked
Substance use, criminal charges, or alcohol abuse in past 3 years
Planned travel outside North America/Caribbean/Western Europe > 12 weeks
Hazardous sports or non-commercial aerial activity planned

name: Assumption - Platinum Protection

rules.description: Applicant's weight must not exceed the threshold corresponding to their height as per the following table

rules: Lost more than 10% body weight in past 12 months
Currently admitted to hospital or in long-term/skilled care
Unexplained symptoms or pending investigations or surgeries
Diagnosed with HIV, ALS, dementia, cystic fibrosis, or terminal illness
Family history of Huntington’s or polycystic kidney disease (age ≤ 50)
Organ/bone marrow transplant, CHF, or cardiomyopathy in last 10 years
Heart attack, angina, stroke, or kidney issues in past 5 years
Cancer (except basal cell) or leukemia in past 5 years
Diabetes + heart/stroke/vascular complications ever
Chronic respiratory disorder needing oxygen in past 10 years
Steroid treatment or hospitalization for respiratory issue (past 2 years)
Hepatitis, cirrhosis, or pancreatitis (chronic or recurrent)
Neurological, autoimmune, or psychiatric illness
Driver’s license suspended or revoked
Substance use, criminal charges, or alcohol abuse in past 3 years
Blood pressure meds added/increased in past 3 months
Planned travel outside North America/Caribbean/Western Europe > 6 weeks
Hazardous sports or non-commercial aerial activity planned

name: CPP - Guaranteed Acceptance Life

rules.description: Applicant's weight must not exceed the threshold corresponding to their height as per the following table

rules: Used tobacco, nicotine, vaping, or marijuana (more than 6 times/week) in the last 12 months
Require assistance with 2 or more daily living activities
Resident of long-term care, nursing home, or assisted living facility
Bedridden or wheelchair-bound
Advised to receive or on waiting list for organ/bone marrow transplant (excluding corneal)
Admitted to hospital for more than 48 hours in the last 60 days (excluding pregnancy)
Advised to have surgery, diagnostic test, or consultation not yet completed or result unknown
Did not follow prescribed treatment or medication
Abnormal test in last 60 days that changed or led to new treatment
Weight exceeds limit based on height (see table)
Diagnosed or treated for HIV, AIDS, ARC, or immune disorder (excluding lupus, RA, type 1 diabetes)
Diagnosed or treated for: metastatic/recurrent cancer, COPD/lung disease (requiring oxygen/steroids), dementia, Parkinson’s, ALS, muscular dystrophy, or heart failure
Diagnosed before age 40 for angina, heart attack, CAD, stroke, TIA, kidney disease, aneurysm, or had bypass/stent/angioplasty

Hazardous sport participation or pilot activity in last 2 years or planned in next year
Driver’s license suspended/revoked in past 2 years or more than 3 moving violations in past 12 months
2 or more immediate family members diagnosed/treated for cancer, heart disease, stroke, or hereditary disease before age 60

name: IA Access Life - Deferred

rules.description: Applicant's weight must not exceed the threshold corresponding to their height as per the following table.

rules: Diagnosed with AIDS or tested positive for HIV
Diagnosed with heart rhythm disorder requiring pacemaker, heart failure, or cardiomyopathy
Diagnosed with cystic fibrosis, Alzheimer’s, dementia, Huntington’s, Parkinson’s, ALS, muscular/myotonic dystrophy, or ataxia
Chronic respiratory disease (excluding sleep apnea) requiring daily oxygen
Under age 18 with type-1 diabetes, cerebral palsy, congenital heart disease, Down’s syndrome, or ASD
Diagnosed or treated for leukemia, lymphoma, or malignant tumor (excluding basal cell carcinoma) in past 3 years
Found guilty of criminal offence or DUI or awaiting trial in past 12 months
Used hard drugs or methadone (unless prescribed) in past 12 months
Currently hospitalized or in nursing facility/home for reduced autonomy
Currently bedridden or wheelchair-bound
Undergoing or awaiting investigation for diagnostic purposes
Weight exceeds threshold based on height for individuals age 15+

rules: Diagnosed with AIDS or tested positive for HIV

Received or advised to receive organ or bone marrow transplant in past 5 years
Treated for drug or alcohol use, joined support group, or advised to reduce use in past 5 years
Diagnosed or treated for heart attack, angina, or valve disease with anticoagulants in past 3 years

Had medication change for mental health in past 12 months
Stopped mental health medication without doctor's advice in past 12 months
Underwent or awaiting aneurysm surgery in past 12 months

Plans to reside outside Canada/USA for 6+ consecutive months
Immediate family diagnosed with Huntington’s or PKD before age 60
Child under age 3 diagnosed with cystic fibrosis

name: Humania - Insurance Without Medical Exam – Life
rules: Unable to confirm no cognitive impairment and independence in daily living activities such as bathing, dressing, toileting, continence, moving, and eating
Absent from work for more than 15 consecutive days due to illness or received disability/critical illness benefits in the past 2 years
Used drugs or alcohol in the past 2 years and received treatment, joined a support group, or was advised to reduce or seek help
Incarcerated for more than 48 hours in the past 5 years
Experienced physical or mental symptoms or discomfort in the past 6 months and has not yet consulted a healthcare professional

name: UV - Express Life Insurance
rules: Used tobacco or smoking-related products in the last 12 months
Currently hospitalized, in a nursing home, using a wheelchair, or require help with 2+ daily living activities
Diagnosed or treated for AIDS, AIDS-related condition, or HIV
Hospitalized or had surgery in the last 60 days (excluding pregnancy)
Abnormal test results in the last 60 days
Advised to undergo tests, investigations, or surgery
Symptoms or abnormal results with no consultation yet
Under investigation or awaiting diagnosis for symptoms
Advised to have tests/surgery that hasn’t been done yet
Doctor advised more frequent medical follow-ups than usual
Cancer with metastasis, 2 different cancers, or recurrence (excluding basal cell)
Cystic fibrosis or chronic respiratory disease requiring daily oxygen (excluding sleep apnea)
Chronic kidney disease or polycystic kidney disease
Dementia, Alzheimer’s, muscular dystrophy, Huntington’s, ALS, or Parkinson’s
Chronic heart failure, cardiomyopathy, or heart valve replacement
Waiting for or received an organ/bone marrow transplant (excluding corneal)
Before age 40 or in last 3 years if age 40+, diagnosed or treated for cerebrovascular accident, TIA, aneurysm, or coronary artery disease
Coronary artery bypass, angioplasty, stent, pacemaker, or chronic kidney disease
Angina or heart attack
Chronic liver disease including cirrhosis, fibrosis, hepatitis B/C
Peripheral arterial/vascular disease
Leukemia, lymphoma, malignant melanoma, breast, ovarian, cervix, lung or colorectal cancer
Insulin-dependent diabetes with diagnosis over 20 years ago or medication changed in last 6 months
Diagnosed or treated for bipolar disorder, schizophrenia, psychosis, borderline personality disorder, or attempted suicide in last 24 months
Unintentional weight loss of 10% or more in last 12 months (excluding diet/lifestyle/pregnancy/bariatric surgery)
Had bariatric surgery in last 6 months
Travel planned outside North America/Caribbean/UK/EU for over 12 weeks in next 12 months
Convicted or charged with a criminal offense in the last 3 years (including impaired driving)
Used illegal drugs or similar substances in last 24 months
Advised to reduce drug or alcohol use by healthcare professional in last 24 months
Stayed in a treatment facility for drug/alcohol abuse in last 24 months

rules.description: Applicant's weight must fall within the minimum and maximum threshold corresponding to their height as per the following table.

rules: Used tobacco or smoking-related products in the last 12 months

Stayed in a treatment facility for drug/alcohol abuse in last 24 months
Angina pectoris or heart attack (myocardial infarction) in the last 5 years
Multiple episodes of angina pectoris or heart attack
Angina pectoris or heart attack with current diabetes
CVA (stroke), TIA, aneurysm, or coronary artery disease in the last 5 years
Multiple episodes of CVA, TIA, aneurysm, or coronary artery disease
CVA, TIA, aneurysm, or coronary artery disease with current diabetes
Coronary artery bypass surgery, angioplasty, or stent insertion in the last 5 years
3 or more vessels affected during bypass, angioplasty, or stent procedures
Coronary procedure with pacemaker due to coronary disease
Coronary procedure with current diabetes
Pacemaker implanted in the last 5 years
Pacemaker received due to coronary artery disease or related procedures
Any cancer (excluding basal cell carcinoma) in the last 5 years
Thyroid cancer with chemotherapy or radiotherapy, affected lymph nodes or metastases
Prostate cancer with abnormal PSA, chemo/radiotherapy, or lymph nodes/metastases
Diagnosed with diabetes or advised blood sugar monitoring (if age ≤ 30)
Diabetes with any of the following: coronary artery disease, heart attack, bypass, angioplasty, stent, peripheral vascular disease, amputation, neuropathy, retinopathy, stroke (CVA), or TIA
Amputation due to illness in the last 3 years
Medication added, removed, or changed in last 3 months without healthcare advice
Anticoagulant therapy in the last 3 months
Family history of polycystic kidney disease (investigated or diagnosed)
Family history of Huntington’s disease
Driver’s licence suspended/revoked in last 24 months or more than 3 traffic violations in last 12 months
Use of illegal drugs or unprescribed barbiturates/narcotics/opioids in the last 5 years
Drug/alcohol abuse treatment or recommendation in the last 5 years
Criminal conviction or charges (including impaired driving) in the last 5 years
Weight outside allowed range according to height chart
